block.securitycraft.laser.name: laser
death.attack.securitycraft.fakeWater: %s tutki onko tämä oikeaa vettä, ei ollut!
help.securitycraft.laser_block.info: The laser block is used by putting two of them within five blocks of each other. When the blocks are placed correctly, a laser should form between them. Whenever a player walks through the laser, both the laser blocks will emit a 15-block redstone signal.
help.securitycraft.keypad.info: The keypad is used by placing the keypad, rightclicking it, and setting a numerical passcode. Once the keycode is set, rightclicking the keypad will allow you to enter the code. If it's correct, the keypad will emit redstone power for three seconds.
help.securitycraft.mine.info: The mine explodes when stepped on by any entity other than creepers, cats, and ocelots. Rightclicking the mine while holding wire cutters will defuse the mine and allow you to break it. Rightclicking with flint and steel equipped will re-enable it.
help.securitycraft.dirt_mine.info: Block mines are standard mines. Walking into it or mining it will cause it to explode.
help.securitycraft.furnace_mine.info: Furnace mines are just like the standard mines, except it only explodes when you rightclick it.
help.securitycraft.retinal_scanner.info: The retinal scanner emits a 15-block redstone signal when the owner of the block stands directly in front of it.
help.securitycraft.keycard_reader.info: The keycard reader emits a 15-block redstone signal if you insert a keycard with a security level equal to or higher than (as specified in the GUI) the level selected in the reader's GUI.
help.securitycraft.reinforced_iron_trapd: The reinforced iron trapdoor is the same as a vanilla trapdoor, except it can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc., and only be broken by the person who placed it down.
help.securitycraft.bouncing_betty.info: The bouncing betty will launch up into the air and explode when touched.
help.securitycraft.inventory_scanner.inf: The inventory scanner is used by placing two scanners a block apart, facing each other. When placed correctly, a laser field should spawn between them. If a player walks through the field, any blocks or items entered in the scanner's GUI in the player's inventory will be deleted.
help.securitycraft.track_mine.info: The track mine explodes when a minecart passes on top of it.
help.securitycraft.cage_trap.info: The cage trap will spawn a 'cage' around any player who walks on top of it.
help.securitycraft.portable_radar.info: The portable radar will send the owner a chat message whenever a player is inside of the radar's detection radius (modifiable in the config file). You can name the portable radar by rightclicking on it with a named name-tag.
help.securitycraft.keypad_chest.info: The password-protected chest is equipped with a password locking system. Whenever the password is entered correctly, the chest's inventory will open.
help.securitycraft.username_logger.info: The username logger will log any player's name within 3 blocks when it is powered by redstone.
help.securitycraft:reinforced.info: Reinforced blocks are unbreakable building blocks with vanilla equivalents. Only the person who placed them down can destroy them using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft.alarm.info: The alarm will emit a siren sound effect whenever it is powered by redstone, and in 2-second intervals after that (modifiable in the config file).
help.securitycraft.reinforced_fence_gate: The reinforced iron fence gate acts the same as a vanilla fence gate, except it is unbreakable, and can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc.. It will also hurt anyone but the owner when they get in contact with it.
help.securitycraft.panic_button.info: The panic button looks like a button, but works the same way as a lever.
help.securitycraft.keypad_frame.info: The frame is used to craft keypads and to display camera views. Rightclick it with a key panel to craft a keypad. With LookingGlass installed: Rightclick it with a bound camera monitor to display a camera's view. Views automatically shutoff after 5 minutes to save resources. (Rightclick again to turn it back on.)
help.securitycraft.claymore.info: Claymores explode one second after a living entity walks within 5 blocks in front of the mine. Rightclicking the claymore while holding wire cutters will defuse the mine and allow you to break it. Rightclicking with flint and steel equipped will re-enable it.
help.securitycraft.keypad_furnace.info: The password-protected furnace will require you to enter a passcode when you first place it down. After that, entering the correct code into the GUI will allow you to access the furnace's inventory.
help.securitycraft.security_camera.info: The security camera allows you to view the nearby area from its position. Simply place down a camera, then rightclick it with a camera monitor to use it.
help.securitycraft.reinforced_glass_pane: The reinforced glass pane is the same as a vanilla glass, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
The reinforced iron bars are the same as a vanilla iron bars, except only the person who placed them down can destroy them using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft.electrified_iron_fenc: The electrified iron fence acts the same as a vanilla fence, except it is unbreakable, and will hurt anyone but the owner when they get in contact with it.
help.securitycraft.ims.info: The I.M.S, or Intelligent Munitions System, is a four-time-use mine that will target players (or mobs) which enter its firing radius. Once a mine is launched, it will track down the entity and explode. Once all four mines are used, the I.M.S. will self-destruct.
help.securitycraft.protecto.info: The protecto, inspired by the enemy from the game "Megaman: Battle Network 2" made by Capcom, will attack any mob in a 10-block radius with lightning bolts every 10 seconds. It must be raining, and able to see the sky to do so.
help.securitycraft.motion_activated_ligh: The motion-activated light will emit a light, similar to a redstone lamp, when a player is within a certain range of the block (configurable).
help.securitycraft.codebreaker.info: The codebreaker will crack any keypad, password-protected chest, or password-protected furnace's code by rightclicking on it. (5 uses with a 2/3 chance of it working)
help.securitycraft.door_indestructible_i: The reinforced iron door is the same as the vanilla iron door, except it is unbreakable. It can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc. The owner of the door can use the universal block remover to break it down.
help.securitycraft.scanner_door_item.inf: The Scanner Door acts like a Retinal Scanner, but opens itself upon looking at the top part. It has to be closed manually again.
help.securitycraft.universal_block_remov: The universal block remover is used to destroy "reinforced" blocks by rightclicking it. Only the person who placed the block down can destroy it.
help.securitycraft.keycard_lv1.info: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.keycard_lv2.info: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.keycard_lv3.info: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.keycard_lv4.info: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.keycard_lv5.info: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.limited_use_keycard.i: The keycards are used with the keycard reader. There are six keycards, level 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 cards, and a limited use card that is equivalent to a level 5 card that can only be used five times in Survival mode.
help.securitycraft.remote_access_mine.in: The mine remote access tool will allow you to access mines remotely. Rightclick on a mine to 'bind' it to the tool. Rightclick in the air (with the tool equipped) to open the tool's GUI, which will allow you to activate, deactivate, or detonate any bound mines.
help.securitycraft.bucket_f_water.info: The fake water acts the same as water, expect it hurts you when touched.
help.securitycraft.bucket_f_lava.info: The fake lava acts the same as lava, except it heals you instead of hurting you.
help.securitycraft.universal_block_modif: The universal block modifier is used to customize various blocks added by SecurityCraft. Rightclick a block to open the customization GUI. You can then insert "modules" to customize how that block functions.
help.securitycraft.redstone_module.info: The redstone module adds power properties to a block.
help.securitycraft.whitelist_module.info: The whitelist module usually removes player(s) from a block's effect or password-checking.
help.securitycraft.blacklist_module.info: The blacklist module usually adds player(s) to a block's effect or blocks them from using a certain function of the block.
help.securitycraft.harming_module.info: The harming module adds damage properties to a block.
help.securitycraft.smart_module.info: The smart module upgrades the range or functions of a block.
help.securitycraft.storage_module.info: The storage module adds or upgrades the size of a block's inventory.
help.securitycraft.disguise_module.info: The disguise module disguises certain blocks when added to them.
help.securitycraft.wire_cutters.info: Rightclicking a mine with the wire cutters will defuse it.
help.securitycraft.keypad_item.info: The key panel is used in the crafting recipes of keypads, password-protected chests, and password-protected furnaces.
help.securitycraft.admin_tool.info: The admin tool's main purpose is to display information about a SecurityCraft block. It will show the owner's UUID and name, and other information, like passcodes and any inserted modules.
help.securitycraft.taser.info: The taser is a self-recharging stun gun. Rightclick to fire it. Entities hit with the taser will get Nausea II, Slowness II, and Weakness II for 10 seconds. If the Taser is sneak-rightclicked (provided some redstone in the inventory) it will double its strength for the next shot.
help.securitycraft.camera_monitor.info: The camera monitor is a handheld screen, used to view live camera feeds. Rightclick a security camera to view it on the monitor. Sometimes, it may automatically shutoff to save resources, simply rightclick to enable it again (configurable).
help.securitycraft.sc_manual.info: The SecurityCraft Manual shows information about all the blocks and items SecurityCraft adds.
help.securitycraft.universal_owner_chang: The Universal Owner Changer can change a block's owner. To do this, rename the item in an anvil to the name of the new owner of the block. Then just rightclick one of your blocks with an owner and it will change. If enabled, blocks without an owner can be claimed by rightclicking with an unnamed Changer.
help.securitycraft.universal_block_reinf: The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces several vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. LvL1 has 300 uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.
The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces several vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. LvL2 has 2700 uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.
The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces several vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. LvL3 has unlimited uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.
help.securitycraft.briefcase.info: The briefcase is a simple keypad-locked item that allows you to store up to twelve additional items in it. After crafting it, rightclick it to setup the 4-digit passcode to use from then on. Rightclick it again and insert the code to view the items.
help.securitycraft.universal_key_changer: The universal key changer allows you to change the passcode of passcode-protected blocks you own. Rightclick a passcode-protected block to open a GUI, then type in the new passcode you want. Craft it together with a Briefcase to remove the code of it.
help.securitycraft.secret_sign_item.info: The Secret Sign works like a vanilla sign, with the slight difference that only the owner of the sign can view the text on it. Make sure noone can break the block it's placed on!
help.securitycraft.sentry.info: The Sentry has three modes that can be switched by rightclicking it. Idle (it will never attack), Camouflage (it will only attack enemy players in its range) and Aggressive (it will attack hostile mobs and enemy players). Rightclicking it with a Disguise Module containing a full and opaque block (e.g. stone, but not glass or stairs) will make the Sentry disguise itself. The module can be switched directly, or extracted by rightclicking with a Universal Block Modifier. To remove the sentry, sneak-rightclick it.
gui.securitycraft.scManual.author: kääntänyt: erland (aka erland yt)
gui.securitycraft:scManual.ownableBlock: Ownable: This block is resistant to explosions, and can only be broken by the player who placed it down using the Universal Block Remover.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.passwordProte: Password protected: This block can only be used if a password set by the owner is correctly entered.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.viewActivated: View activated: This block can be activated by hovering over it with your cursor while in block-breaking range.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.explosiveBloc: Explosive: This block is able to be remotely detonated, and may be able to be activated/deactivated, using the Mine Remote Access Tool.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.customizableB: Customizable: You may use the Universal Block Modifier and the various modules added by SecurityCraft to customize the functions of this block.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.keypad: Place down a Frame and rightclick it with a Key Panel.
Place down a Chest and rightclick it with a Key Panel.
Place down a Furnace and rightclick it with a Key Panel.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.reinfo: Any reinforced block can be crafted as follows, if not otherwise specified in this book. Place down the vanilla equivalent (e.g. Reinforced Stone -> Stone) and break it with a Universal Block Reinforcer, or rightclick the Universal Block Reinforcer, put it into the slot and close the GUI.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.adminT: The Admin Tool is only available via the creative inventory, if it is enabled via the config file.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.sc_man: The SecurityCraft Manual is only available via the creative inventory or by typing "/sc help" (without quotes).
gui.securitycraft:invScan.explanation.1: This setting will check a player's
gui.securitycraft:invScan.explanation.2: inventory, and, if it contains a
gui.securitycraft:keycardSetup.explanati: Select the level of security that
you want. Only players with a
level you select will be able to
gui.securitycraft:protectedFurnace.name: salasanasuojattu uuni
gui.securitycraft:monitor.cameraInDiffer: You may not view this camera now, as this camera is in another dimension with the ID #.
gui.securitycraft:blockReinforcer.title: Universal Block Reinforcer
messages.securitycraft:bugReport: You can report a crash or a bug using this GoogleDocs form
messages.securitycraft:securityCamera.mo: You are now mounted to a camera. Use the #w#a#s#d keys to move the camera's view, and the #i/#o buttons to zoom in and out.
messages.securitycraft:retinalScanner.no: I'm sorry, you cannot use this scanner. It is owned by #.
messages.securitycraft:portableRadar.wit: #p is near your portable radar named #n.
#p is near your portable radar at #l.
messages.securitycraft:codebreakerDisabl: The codebreaker has been disabled through the config file.
messages.securitycraft:keycardReader.req: Required security level: #r - Your keycard's level: #c
messages.securitycraft:invScan.notConnec: This is not connected to another inventory scanner block!
messages.securitycraft:module.notHolding: You must be holding the module you wish to save data from.
messages.securitycraft:module.nothingSav: There is no module data saved.
messages.securitycraft:module.alreadyCon: The module you are holding already contains the player #.
messages.securitycraft:module.notHolding: You must be holding the module you wish to modify!
messages.securitycraft:notOwned: I'm sorry, you cannot do that to this block. This block is owned by #.
messages.securitycraft:adminTool.noInfo: This block has no information to display!
messages.securitycraft:reinforcedSlab.ca: You must be the owner of this block to turn it into a double slab.
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.can: You can't view a camera that doesn't belong to you.
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.rig: Rightclick a security camera to view it.
messages.securitycraft:mrat.noSlots: There are no more empty slots to bind this mine to!
messages.securitycraft:mrat.cantBind: You can't bind a mine that doesn't belong to you.
messages.securitycraft:mrat.bound: Bound the mine at # to the remote access tool.
messages.securitycraft:mrat.unbound: Unbound the mine at # from the remote access tool.
messages.securitycraft:universalOwnerCha: You need to give this item the name of the new block owner. Use an anvil to rename it.
This block cannot hold an owner. Please rightclick an appropriate SecurityCraft block.
This is not your block, you cannot change its owner.
You cannot claim blocks without an owner.
messages.securitycraft:irc.connected: IRC chat is no longer supported as of v1.8.3 of SecurityCraft. If you need help, please refer to the #help channel on SecurityCraft's Discord!
messages.securitycraft:frame.rightclick: Rightclick with a bound monitor to view it.
messages.securitycraft:command.sc.usage: Usage: /sc connect OR /sc disconnect OR /sc contact OR /sc resume
messages.securitycraft:naming.error: You cannot name this block '#n', as the name contains the invalid character '#c'.
messages.securitycraft:tip.scHelp: Typing /sc help will give you a SecurityCraft manual, which will display help info for SecurityCraft blocks/items.
messages.securitycraft:tip.trello: Check out the Trello board for SecurityCraft, and report bugs or give us suggestions!
messages.securitycraft:tip.patreon: Do you want to support SecurityCraft?
messages.securitycraft:tip.discord: Join our Discord server to chat and to receive important updates and announcements regarding SecurityCraft!
messages.securitycraft:tip.scserver: The official SecurityCraft server is back! Join using this IP: 64.38.249.237
messages.securitycraft:universalKeyChang: Rightclick a keypad with the universal key changer to change its passcode.
messages.securitycraft:passwordProtected: This block doesn't have a password yet. You cannot interact with it.
messages.securitycraft:sentry.needsBlock: You have to place the Sentry on top of a block!
Make sure, that your Sentry is surrounded with blocks on all of its four sides!
messages.securitycraft:sentry.descriptio: (Always active, attacks hostile mobs and players)
(Active when a player comes near, attacks players)
jei.securitycraft:reinforcedBlock.info: Rightclick a Universal Block Reinforcer and place the following block into the slot. Alternatively you can place the following block down and break it with the Universal Block Reinforcer.
You may add # block(s) and $ item(s).
module.securitycraft.ims.whitelist_modul: Adding a whitelist module to an I.M.S. will allow the whitelisted players to walk into the range of the I.M.S without being targeted.
module.securitycraft.inventory_scanner.w: Adding a whitelist module to an inventory scanner will allow whitelisted players to walk through the scanning field without checking their inventory.
module.securitycraft.inventory_scanner.s: Adding a smart module to an inventory scanner will make the scanner check for enchantments and other metadata changes when scanning inventories.
Adding a storage module will allow the scannners to store the items it deletes in a built-in inventory.
module.securitycraft.keycard_reader.whit: Adding a whitelist module to a keycard reader will allow players to use the reader using any keycard.
module.securitycraft.keycard_reader.blac: Adding a blacklist module to a keycard reader will ban players from interacting with the reader.
module.securitycraft.keypad.whitelist_mo: Adding a whitelist module to a keypad will allow players to use the block without knowing the code.
module.securitycraft.keypad.blacklist_mo: Adding a blacklist module to a keypad will ban players from interacting with the block.
module.securitycraft.keypad.disguise_mod: Adding a disguise module to a keypad will cause the texture of it to change to the bookshelf's texture.
module.securitycraft.laser_block.harming: Adding a harming module to a laser block will cause players to take damage if they step through the lasers.
module.securitycraft.laser_block.whiteli: Adding a whitelist module to a laser block will allow players to walk through the lasers without emitting a redstone signal.
module.securitycraft.portable_radar.reds: Adding a redstone module to a portable radar will cause the radar to emit a redstone signal whenever a player is within range.
module.securitycraft.portable_radar.whit: Adding a whitelist module to a portable radar will remove the whitelisted players from the radar's search.
module.securitycraft.retinal_scanner.whi: Adding the whitelist module to a retinal scanner will allow players to use the scanner even if they aren't the player who placed down the block.
module.securitycraft.security_camera.red: Adding the redstone module to a camera lets the camera emit a 15-block redstone signal when enabled.
module.securitycraft.protecto.whitelist_: Adding a whitelist module to a protecto will allow the whitelisted players to walk into the range of the protecto without being targeted.
config.securitycraft:allowAdminTool.tool: Can the admin tool be used?
config.securitycraft:shouldSpawnFire.too: Should mines spawn fire after exploding?
config.securitycraft:ableToBreakMines.to: Should players be able to break a mine without it exploding?
config.securitycraft:ableToCraftLUKeycar: Is the limited use keycard craftable?
config.securitycraft:smallerMineExplosio: Should mines' explosions be smaller than usual.
config.securitycraft:mineExplodesWhenInC: Mines explode when broken in Creative?
Should mines explode if broken while in Creative mode?
If LookingGlass is installed, should monitor views turn off to save resources after 5 minutes have passed since it was activated?
config.securitycraft:useLookingGlass.too: Should SecurityCraft use LookingGlass for viewing cameras?\n\nAutomatically gets set to "false" if LookingGlass is not installed.
config.securitycraft:portableRadarSearch: From how many blocks can the portable radar detect players?
config.securitycraft:usernameLoggerSearc: From how many blocks can the username logger detect players?
config.securitycraft:laserBlockRange.too: From how many blocks away can a laser block connect to another laser block?
config.securitycraft:alarmTickDelay.tool: If an alarm is activated, how many seconds in-between alarm sounds effects?
config.securitycraft:alarmSoundVolume.to: What volume should the alarm sound effect be played at?
If a portable radar is activated, how many seconds should pass before the radar searches again?
config.securitycraft:claymoreRange.toolt: From how many blocks can the claymore mine be tripped from?
config.securitycraft:imsRange.tooltip: How many blocks away can the I.M.S. detect players from?
config.securitycraft:sayThanksMessage.to: Should a 'tip' message be sent to player when joining a world?
config.securitycraft:debuggingMode.toolt: Should SecurityCraft run in debug mode? (logs extra things to the console, may add unfinished items/blocks that could be buggy.)
config.securitycraft:isIrcBotEnabled.too: Is the built-in Internet Relay Chat bot (used when using the commands "/sc connect" and "/sc contact") enabled?
config.securitycraft:disconnectOnWorldCl: Disconnect IRC bot on world exited?
If you've used the commands "/sc connect" or "/sc contact", should the IRC bot disconnect if you leave the world you're in?
Should the outdated keypad recipe of nine buttons be enabled?
config.securitycraft:cameraSpeed.tooltip: How fast can you rotate when mounted to a camera and holding W-A-S-D?
config.securitycraft:checkForUpdates: Should check for updates on GitHub?
config.securitycraft:checkForUpdates.too: Should SecurityCraft check for new updates of the mod through SecurityCraft's GitHub repository?
option.securitycraft.portable_radar.sear: The radius the radar searches in.
The rate at which the radar searches at.
option.securitycraft.portable_radar.repe: Should the radar repeat the message as long as someone is in its radius?
option.securitycraft.portable_radar.enab: Should the Portable Radar search for any players?
option.securitycraft.security_camera.rot: The speed at which the camera rotates.
option.securitycraft.keypad.isAlwaysActi: Should the keypad remain active and unlocked?
option.securitycraft.retinal_scanner.act: Can this scanner be activated by NPC mobs that look at it?
option.securitycraft.cage_trap.captureMo: Should this cage trap capture hostile mobs and players, or only players?
option.securitycraft.motion_activated_li: How far will the light detect an entity?
